gamenews.headline: Wheel of Destiny
gamenews.message:
The Wheel of Destiny enables you to further specialise your character based on your needs and playstyle as you level up.

The Wheel of Destiny offers something to look forward to for all promoted Premium characters above level 50.

You will gain promotion points which you can use to unlock various benefits ranging from small perks all the way up to new powerful spells and abilities depending on your vocation.

You can spend and remove points for free!

Whenever you have promotion points to spend, simply open the Wheel of Destiny and spend your points. You can do this any time. To remove or reset already invested points you have to be in a temple, though.

Perks

The Wheel of Destiny is divided into four domains. Each domain contains nine slices. So in total, there are 36 slices which you can fill with points to improve your character.

 

  • Dedication Perks have small effects. They gradually increase existing characteristics, e.g. your HP or your mana. Every promotion point invested into a Dedication Perk raises the bonus in question a bit till you have assigned the maximum number of points possible for this slice.
  • Conviction Perks have medium to large effects. They augment existing spells, grant vocation-specific passive abilities or generally useful bonuses, e.g. elemental resistance. You unlock a Conviction Perk once you have filled the respective slice to the max. Most Conviction Perks can be found more than once within the Wheel of Destiny. When they are unlocked, their effects add up.
                   
  • Revelation Perks have powerful effects. They grant new spells or strong passive effects with considerable impact. There are four Revelation Perks and each of them is assigned to one of the four domains of the wheel. You unlock a Revelation Perk once you have spent enough promotion points in the respective domain. Spending more points in the same domain will unlock the more powerful stages two and three of this Revelation Perk.

The Wheel of Destiny Presets allow you to switch between various wheel setups while you are in the temple. Presets can also be imported and exported. This means you can also share your setups with friends or transfer them to a different character.

The Wheel of Destiny Planner on the website allows you to select a vocation and freely distribute points. It also displays how many Promotion Points are required for your current specification and you will also be able to import and export your ingame setups. You can also set a limit for the points when using Planner.

gamenews.headline: Bug Reporting
gamenews.message:
You found a bug in Tibia and want to report it? Here is how:

1) If you find a bug in Tibia, you can report by using the key combination Ctrl+Z. 
This opens a special client dialog to report . It can also be opened via the context menu entry "Report Coordinate".

2) Select a fitting category for your bug report:

  • Typo
  • Technical
  • If you are unsure, select "Other"
  • If you want to report a map bug or an NPC bug, please check the report steps provided further below.

3) Describe the issue you encountered.

  • Include a step by step explanation as to how to reproduce the bug.
  • Make it as detailed as necessary and as short as possible.
  • Focus on important information. Leave out anything which is not crucial to understand the problem.
Bug reports automatically include your character name as well as the coordinates of the map field on which your character stood when submitting the bug. You do not need to provide this information in your report.

4) Click on "Send" to submit your bug report.
The submission of your bug report will be confirmed with the message "Comment sent" in your game window and server log.

Map Bugs

  • To report map bugs, right-click on the map field in question.
  • Select the entry "Report Coordinate" from the context menu.
    • The coordinate you clicked on will be sent automatically with your report.
  • Describe the map bug.

NPC Chat Bugs

  • To report mistakes in NPC chats, right-click on the NPC text in question.
  • Select the context menu entry "Report Message".
    • The NPC's name and line will then be sent automatically with your report.
  • Quote the typo or mistake.

General Info

To be able to report bugs, your account must have accumulated at least 30 loyalty points.

Each account can submit up to 5 bug reports per day.

An account can be blocked from submitting bug reports, e.g. in case of abusing the bug report function.

The bug report function is reserved exclusively for bugs, do not use it to report rule violations or illegal names!


Types of Bug
Map Bug:

If you see broken graphics, blue pixels, wrong automap colours, broken ground textures or strange looking wall parts, you have most likely found a map bug. 
 
Typo Bug:
 You are talking to an NPC or read a dusty old parchment and some of the words do not make any sense? Congratulations, your sharp eyes have spotted a typo. 
 
Technical Bug:
 An NPC is not working properly, e.g. refuses to trade or denies you access to a quest even though you fulfil the requirements? Select "Technical" in the bug report dialog to inform us about such issues.
The same goes for dead ends or loop holes in quests or world events. 
 
Other Bugs:
 In case you have stumbled upon an issue that does not fit the above mentioned bugs or if you are unsure, select "Other" in the bug report dialog.
 
Client Crash:
 Besides bugs in game, you might experience occasional client crashes during the test server. Usually, a crash report window will open once you have started the client again. Please describe the situation you were in when the crash occurred or if the usage of a specific client feature can provoke such crash. Sending the crash report is very important since it provides us with valuable insights about the cause.

gamenews.headline: Wheel of Destiny: Gem Atelier
gamenews.message:
The Gem Atelier in the Wheel of Destiny offers expansive ways to amplify your character's power.

Archfoe bosses, influenced and fiendish creatures can drop gems for each vocation:

Guardian gems for knights, Marksman gems for paladins, Sage gems for sorcerers and Mystic gems for druids.

You can either trade gems or reveal those for your vocation in the Gem Atelier.

You can access the Gem Atelier by opening the Wheel of Destiny and clicking on the tab "Gem Atelier".
There, you can reveal gems to discover their inherent powers, thus binding them to your character. This means they can no longer be traded or given to other characters.


Gems come in three sizes granting various boosts for your character:

  • Lesser gems have 1 basic mod:
    • stats (HP, mana, capacity, mitigation multiplier), basic resistances (fire, earth, energy, ice) or stat + basic resistance (e.g. HP + fire resistance)
  • Regular gems have 2 basic mods:
    • resistances (basic resistances, holy, death, physical, mana drain, life drain)
  • Greater gems have 2 basic mods and 1 supreme mod:
    • critical extra damage, life leech, mana leech, dodge, spell augments, revelation mastery

The Wheel of Destiny consists of four domains.

When a gem is revealed, it not only gains mods but also a colour representing its domain affinity in the wheel.

If you reveal a gem with great stats but for the wrong domain, you can switch the domain affinity of a gem clockwise for gold.

To enjoy the bonuses of gem mods, place the gem in the vessel that matches its domain affinity. The activation of mod bonuses depends on how many Vessel Resonance perks you have filled in this domain of the wheel:
  • None: Sealed vessel, no mod active.
  • One: Dormant vessel, first mod active.
  • Two: Awakened vessel, first and second mod active.
  • Three: Radiant vessel, all mods active, including supreme mods.

Active mods are displayed with their icon in the Vessel Resonance perks in the wheel. To the left you see a perk without an active Mod, to the right you see it with an active Mod:

If the Vessel Resonance matches the size of the gem you have placed into this vessel, you will gain a bonus of +1 to both Damage and Healing for lesser and regular gems.
Placing a greater gem into a radiant vessel will increase this bonus to +2.

Gems can be locked or unlocked by clicking on the small lock icon located at the top left corner of the gem. When a gem is locked, you cannot change its domain or destroy it.

 

Via the Button "Dismantle", you can dismantle gems that you do not need anymore.
In return, you will receive fragments.

 

Fragments can be used to enhance your mods in the Fragment Workshop.
You cannot dismantle gems that are locked, placed in a vessel, or are the last one you have of a particular domain.

You can check a list of all available mods in the Wheel of Destiny Planner on the website by selecting a vocation and then clicking in one of the four vessels. In the dropdown lists, you can see which mods are available for each mod slot.

gamenews.headline: Manage Containers
gamenews.message:
How to quickly manage and arrange the contents of your backpacks:
 

The Manage Containers dialog allows you to assign categories to your containers to automatically sort quick-looted items if you have Premium status.

To assign a loot categoy, press the crosshairs button next to it and click on the container of your choice. Done!

From now on, quick-looted items of this category will be automatically put into that container.

To remove a loot category from a container, simply press the X button next to the category in the Manage Containers dialog.

You can assign multiple categories to the same loot container.

If you hover over the small bag icon in the lower right corner of a container that has at least one category assigned to it, these categories will be displayed.

Items that belong to categories which you have not assigned to a specific container, will be quick looted into the Unassigned Loot container.

Per default, this is your main container, the one you have equipped in the body slot. You can also select a different container for unassigned loot via the Manage Loot Containers dialog.

In the Options menu under Misc > Gameplay, there are two options that can help to organise items obtained from NPC traders or the stash:

If you enable Auto-Sort Purchases and Auto-Sort Stash into Containers, any purchased goods and items retrieved from the stash will be automatically placed into containers based on your pre-set filters.

Bought and retrieved potions will be placed into the caregory "Potions" while quick-looted potions will be placed into "Looted Potions".

Quick Sort Container

You can sort the contents of your backpacks according to various criteria by opening the respective menu.

Sorting options include sorting ascending/descending by name, weight, expiry and stack size.

Additionally, you can sort nested containers, prioritise backpacks to be sorted first within the inventory, and you can switch on the manual sort mode to be able to drag and drop items to any location within the backpack.

gamenews.headline: The Soulpit
gamenews.message:
Conquer the very soul of a creature in the Soulpit to unlock its Animus Mastery, a permanent experience boost. 

Whenever you kill a fiendish creature, you have a chance to obtain its soul core. Rarely, it may also drop the soul core of an uncommon, rare, or very rare creature within the same Bestiary class.

A soul core is your key to a challenging fight against stronger versions of this creature in the Soulpit.

You can transform a soul core into another one that might better suit your preferences.
There are three options:

1) Soul Prism + Soul Core = Transforms a soul core into one of the next higher Bestiary difficulty.

  + =

Soul prisms can be looted from fiendish creatures.

2) Exalted Core + Soul Core = Transforms a soul core into one of the next lower Bestiary difficulty.

  + =

Exalted cores can be obtained by converting slivers at the Exaltatation Forge.

3 )Soul Core + Soul Core = Combines two soul cores into a random soul core of any Bestiary difficulty.

  + =

The Soulpit is located in the north-eastern part of Hrodmir.

Enter the ice skull and use the obelisk inside with a soul core to get teleported into the pit. 
Only one soul core is needed to teleport a group of up to 5 players.

Prepare to fight four increasingly difficult waves of descendants of the soul core creature.;
In the final wave, a particularly strong specimen challenges you with one of three special abilities:

Enrage

The creature's damage and resilience increases as its vitality wanes

Oppressor

Can leave you hexed, simultaneously feared and rooted, or powerless

Overpower

Allows your enemy to torture you with sudden spikes in damage.

You have 10 minutes to complete the entire challenge. Be careful! The regular death penalty applies in the Soulpit.

Soulpit creatures do not drop loot or dust, they are not tameable or skinnable, and they do not count towards kill counters or kill statistics.

Soulpit creatures in the first three waves do not yield XP.
Defeating the final wave and thereby completing the challenge will grant you 2800% more XP than killing the usual creature.

It also unlocks the creature's animus mastery for all participants present at the time of success: You now benefit of a permanent XP bonus of 2% for that creature.

 

You can increase this bonus up to 4%:
It will increase by 0.1% for every 10 animus masteries you unlock.
The maximum bonus of 4% is reached when you have mastered 200 different creatures.

You can also earn a title, an achievement and a special keepsake for unlocking animus mastery for numerous creatures.

gamenews.headline: Wheel of Destiny: Fragment Workshop
gamenews.message:
The Fragment Workshop allows you to upgrade mods to harness the full power of your gems.

You can access the Fragment Workshop by opening the Wheel of Destiny and clicking on the respective tab.

There, you can enhance your gem mods from Grade I to Grade IV to increase their power.

 

These upgrades require gold and fragments. Fragments are remnants of shattered gems.

 

Gems can be looted from Archfoe bosses, influenced and fiendish creatures.

To obtain fragments, you can either crush unrevealed gems with a crusher or amber crusher, or you can dismantle revealed gems in the Gem Atelier.

Fragments can also be purchased from jewelry shop NPCs, though this convenient option is priced accordingly.

 

 

 

Depending on the quality of the gem and whether it is revealed or unrevealed, you will receive a certain number of fragments.

  Lesser Gem Regular Gem Greater Gem
Unrevealed Gem 1-4 lesser fragments 2-8 lesser fragments 1-4 greater fragments
Revealed Gem 1-5 lesser fragments 2-10 lesser fragments 1-5 greater fragments

How to enhance mods in the Fragment Workshop?

If you click on a mod, you can check its unlocked and unlockable grades and their effects in the "Enhance Mod Grade" section.
It also shows how much gold and how many fragments you need to invest to unlock the next grade for this mod.
For a basic mod, you need lesser fragments; for a supreme mod, you need greater fragments.

 

Raising mods to their highest grade also earns you permanent promotion points: 
For every Grade IV mod, you will receive an additional Promotion Point for your Wheel of Destiny.

If you enhance a mod, its grade will be raised on all gems the mod appears on.
However, the effectiveness of the enhanced mod on a gem is limited
by the grade of the mods that come before it on the gem.
If they have a lower grade, the mod in question is also limited to that lower grade.

 

A special icon and tooltip in the Gem Atelier inform you if the grade of an enhanced mod is limited by the grade of a preceeding mod.
